alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 5:35PM AKST until December 27 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation of freezing drizzle, freezing rain, sleet, and snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to one quarter of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of the eastern Gulf Coast and portions of the central Inner Channels including Sitka, Angoon, and Port Alexander. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Smooth, bare surfaces especially, may obtain a light glaze that could be very treacherous for pedestrians and vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain and snow mix has already been reported in Sitka and Yakutat. Precipitation, including freezing liquid precipitation will increase this evening. Precipitation looks to transition more to snow later this evening but could change back to freezing drizzle early Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island
